TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 740
TEI.2.document_title: Juan Davis Bradburn to Stephen F Austin, 01-24-1832

barker_notes.barker_summary: Juan Davis Bradburn to Austin, January 24, 1832. Fixing a rendezvous to discuss public affairs.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 740

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Juan Davis Bradburn to Austin, January 24, 1832. Fixing a rendezvous to discuss public affairs.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Anahuac */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="01-24-1832">January 24th 1832*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*My esteemed*person_mentioned* Colonel Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*I have seen*person_mentioned* Mr McKinney*/person_mentioned* and received his information respecting public tranquility of which I was previously in possession I hear with pleasure your proposed interview and should be happy to go as far as*location_mentioned* Saint Philipe */location_mentioned*to meet you, as I consider you very weak from your exhausting sickness, if my manifold avocations, and more numerous embarasments, expecting every moments *person_mentioned*trops */person_mentioned*from *location_mentioned*Matamoros*/location_mentioned*, directing the various *location_mentioned*sections of Publeck Works*/location_mentioned* on this *location_mentioned*Point*/location_mentioned*, *location_mentioned*Land office*/location_mentioned* business, and other negociations, did not employ my existence the most shackled of human beings, yet I shall make an exertion, and will meet you at any place you will appoint on the *location_mentioned*San Jacinto*/location_mentioned* or the *location_mentioned*Buffalo Bayo.*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*I have not answered your letter handed me by*person_mentioned* Mr. Treet*/person_mentioned* and which threw me into some consternation it might create an arduous, if not an insuperable difficulty in any person placed in my posetion and circumstances to do so without very poignant feeling and communicating the same perhaps to his correspondent however our polished atmosphere seems more serene and I shall meet jovl when and as soon as you please*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Juan Davis Bradburn */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*/div1*
